title: Preparing for the New Year
context: Two men, A and B, are speaking together.

2.speaker: A
2.text: In two months, we'll have celebrations for the New Year.

4.speaker: B
4.text: This time, the people from village X will be coming to our community.

5.speaker: B
5.text: men and women, children, old people, families

requires: old people POSSESSOR REFERENCE TO CONCEPT
old people POSSESSEE REFERENCE TO CONCEPT

6.speaker: A
6.text: We must welcome them in a friendly way

requires: having to AGENT REFERENCE TO CONCEPT
having to COMPLEMENT REFERENCE TO CONCEPT
friendly way POSSESSOR REFERENCE TO CONCEPT
friendly way POSSESSEE REFERENCE TO CONCEPT

7.speaker: A
7.text: just like they did to us last year

8.speaker: B
8.text: Yes, of course, as we always do!

9.speaker: A
9.text: Our leaders will start with a welcome speech

requires: welcome speech POSSESSOR REFERENCE TO CONCEPT
welcome speech POSSESSEE REFERENCE TO CONCEPT

10.speaker: A
10.text: then people will play in the morning

11.speaker: A
11.text: After that, we will all share lunch together.

requires: sharing OBLIQUE ROLE REFERENCE TO CONCEPT

12.speaker: B
12.text: In the afternoon, I hope we can have songs and dances.

13.speaker: A
13.text: The people of X will sing their songs, dance their dances,

14.speaker: B
14.text: Then we too, we will sing our songs, dance our dances.

18.speaker: B
18.text: Then our elders will tell stories from the olden times to our youngs.

requires: telling OBLIQUE ROLE TO REFERENCE TO CONCEPT

21.speaker: B
21.text: Then, late afternoon, our two communities will part again.

22.speaker: B
22.text: That will be the end of the day of celebration.

23.speaker: A
23.text: Remember that you and I are in charge of the organization this year.

requires: being in charge of EVENT TENSE
being in charge of PATIENT REFERENCE TO CONCEPT
being in charge of AGENT REFERENCE TO CONCEPT

24.speaker: A
24.text: Perhaps, we should organize a meeting in the community tomorrow morning

requires: a meeting POSSESSOR REFERENCE TO CONCEPT
a meeting POSSESSEE REFERENCE TO CONCEPT

25.speaker: B
25.text: and tell our people what they should do.

requires: telling OBLIQUE ROLE TO REFERENCE TO CONCEPT

26.speaker: A
26.text: Some people can prepare the village for the celebration.

requires: preparing OBLIQUE ROLE FOR REFERENCE TO CONCEPT

27.speaker: B
27.text: Other people can make costumes for the dances.

requires: fabricating OBLIQUE ROLE FOR REFERENCE TO CONCEPT

28.speaker: B
28.text: We must choose which dances to showcase

requires: having to AGENT REFERENCE TO CONCEPT
having to COMPLEMENT REFERENCE TO CONCEPT
having to AGENT REFERENCE TO CONCEPT
having to COMPLEMENT REFERENCE TO CONCEPT

30.speaker: A
30.text: Also, we'll have to prepare food for two hundred people.

requires: having to AGENT REFERENCE TO CONCEPT
having to COMPLEMENT REFERENCE TO CONCEPT
preparing OBLIQUE ROLE FOR REFERENCE TO CONCEPT

31.speaker: B
31.text: Oh dear, that will be a lot of work for us all.

requires: existing OBLIQUE ROLE FOR REFERENCE TO CONCEPT

32.speaker: A
32.text: A lot of work indeed, let's start today!
